titles: Greuous grones for the poore Done by a well-willer, who wisheth, that the poore of England might be so prouided for, as none should neede to go a begging within this realme.
author: Sparke, Michael, d. 1653, attributed name.
Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632, attributed name.
publisher: Printed [by William Jaggard] for Michaell Sparke,
notes: Sometimes misattributed to Michael Sparke and to Thomas Dekker.
The first leaf is blank; the final leaf contains verse.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
